description: From French négresse, from nègre. Equivalent to Negro +‎ -ess.

entries.meaning: (dated, literary, now offensive and an ethnic slur) A black female.
examples: Directly they were trotted off in their little pea-green and gilt carriage, guardian negress and all, I went into the shop, about which I had all this time been loafingly prowling, and called, clapping my hands, for some violet sherbet,  […]
